page.title: 17MRS.WILSON-HATHERDEN
page.content: Mrs.Wilson is one of Hatherden's oldest residents and came to live in the village in 1932.She has two sons and five grandchildren and lives in a house which is over 200 years old . When she first moved in the house was part of a poultry farm covering 17 acres which she still owns.After an accident to her late husband they stopped keeping poultry and now the land is rented to Dunning's Farm.Mrs. Wilson used to work as a nurse at the Andover War Memorial Hospital and still maintains her love for nursing by her membership of the St. John's Ambulance Brigade.Her other hobbies include spinning, painting and gardening. Her earliest memories of the village include thatched cottages where the Hamster car park is now,a village general shop and a reading room at St.Francis'House .
